contentList.content: Choose an ability score to increase by 2, if you gain more than one increase, you can’t apply those increases to the same ability score, and you can’t increase a score above 20.
A ring, stud, or other piece of jewelry worn in a pierced part of the body.

Any trait that lets you cast a spell now allows you to cast that spell using any spell slots you have. You also get to decide whether to use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for these spells when selecting your race.

Humans, elves, dwarves, and halflings do their best to make their way amid the tumult; however, several more racial rarities call Faerûn their home. These people strive and suffer along with the other mortal races—but their existences are far and few between compared to the standard races of Faerûn, adding a touch of wonder and uniqueness to those unfamiliar with them.
You can replace all the proficiencies granted by the Keen Senses trait to another proficiency of your choice.
You channel primal magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature, on hit you deal [1].
You channel primal magic to cause your fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. On hit you deal [1], after you make the attack, your fingernails return to normal.
You channel primal magic to cause your teeth to sharpen, ready to deliver a corrosive attack. On hit you deal [1] after your teeth return to normal.
Your efforts or natural talent have rewarded you expertise in a skill, choose one skill. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the selected skill.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
You can use this trait equal to [1] this amount increases with your Proficiency Bonus. After finishing a Long Rest regain you regain all expended uses.

Once you cast a spells with this trait you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. In addition, you can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You gain Inspiration whenever you finish a Long Rest.
You gain the Skilled Feat or another 1st Level Feat of your choice.
Your Hit Point Maximum increases by your [1].
Your divine creator gave you an uncanny affinity for working with stone or metal.
You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations of creatures not flying.
You gain tremorsense with a [1]. You must be on a stone surface or touching such surface to use this Tremorsense. The stone can be natural or worked.

You can cast Enlarge/Reduce spell on yourself with this trait, and beginning at 5th level you can also cast Invisibility spell on yourself with this trait, without requiring a material component for either spells.
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed or stunned condition on yourself.
You have proficiency with Stealth skill checks.
Long ago, the gith rose up to overthrow the Mind FLayers that held them in servitude, but two factions arose that remain bitter enemies today.

You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. Whenever you finish a long rest, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.

You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. Whenever you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.
You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane.

You know the mage hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, yopu can cast the Jump spell with this trait. 5th level, you can also cast the misty step spell with it.
You can cast these spells using any spell slots you have instead.
Eons of cultivating their mental powers within the endless chaos of Limbo have imbued githzerai with the ability to shape psionic energy to protect themselves and probe minds.

You know the mage hand cantrip, and the hand is invisible when you cast the cantrip with this trait. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the shield spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the detect thoughts spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
You can cast these spells using any spell slots you have instead. You use the spells using your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.
You have advantage on saving throws against the charmed and frightened conditions. Under the tutelage of monastic masters, githzerai learn to govern their own minds.
Githyanki complement their physical prowess with psionic might, instilled in them by mind flayers and cultivated over eons in the Astral Plane.
You have resistance to psychic damage.
Towering over most folk, Goliaths are distant descendants of giants. Each Goliath bears the blessings of the first giants.
You are a decendant of Giants. You inherited a supernatural boon from your ancestry.
As a bonus action, you can magically Teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
You magically Teleport up to [1] to an unoccupied space you can see.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
When you hit a target with an Attack Roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal Fire Damage to that target.
When you hit a target with an Attack Roll and deal damage to it, you can also deal 1d6 Cold Damage to that target and reduce its Speed by 10 ft until the start of your next turn.
The creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet.
When you hit a Large or smaller creature with an Attack Roll and deal damage to it, you can knock that target Prone.
When you take damage you can use your Reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.
Using your Reaction you deal 1d8 Thunder Damage after being attacked by a creature.
When you take damage from a creature within 60 feet of you, you can use your Reaction to deal 1d8 Thunder damage to that creature.
You gain the ability to supernaturally grow. As a Bonus Action, you change your Size to Large, proided you're in a big enough space.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
You have Advantage on Strength Checks, and your Speed is increased by 10ft.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
You have proficiency in the Athletics skill, and you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.
You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, even if you’ve never been to one.
Gruumsh's blessings have mad orcs tireless guardians and mighty allies wherever they are found, even when they turn their devotion to other gods.
You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. Furthermore, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to [1].
You are part of an Elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.
You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trance-like meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Whenever you finish this trance, you can gain two proficiencies that you don’t have, each one with a weapon or a tool of your choice. You mystically acquire these proficiencies by drawing them from shared elven memory, and you retain them until you finish your next long rest.

You are part of an elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can select a Arcane Cantrip, or replace it with another. Starting, at 3rd level, you can cast the Detect Magic spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Misty Step spell with this trait, without requiring a material component.

Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait. Once you cast Detect Magic or Misty Step with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You can select a Cantrip from the Arcane Spell List.
Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace that Cantrip with a different Cantrip from the Arcane Spell List.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Acid Splash cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Blade Ward cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Chill Touch cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Dancing Lights cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Firebolt cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Friends cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Light cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Mending cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Minor Illusion cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Prestidigitation cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the True Strike cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Vicious Mockery cantrip.

You are part of an elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. The range of your Darkvision increases to 120 ft. You also know the Dancing Lights Cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Darkness spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast Faerie Fire or Darkness with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.

You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

You are part of an elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. Your speed increases to 35 feet. You also know the Druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Longstrider spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Pass Without Trace spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast Longstrider or Pass Without Trace with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.
Once shadar-kai were Fey like the rest of their elven kin; now they exist in a state between life and death, thanks to being transformed by the Shadowfell's grim energy.
You have resistance to necrotic damage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Blessing of the Raven Queen: Resistance
You also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.
Sea elves fell in love with the wild beauty of the ocean in the earliest days of the multiverse.
You can breathe air and water, and you have resistance to cold damage.

Aquatic animals have an extraordinary affinity with your people. You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast that has a swimming speed. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.

The pallid elves are a mystical and insightful people with skin as pale as the surface of Exandria’s largest moon. They emerged from the Pallid Grove this century and wander the world with childlike curiosity.
You have advantage on Investigation and Insight checks.

You know the light cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the sleep spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the invisibility spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn’t require material components. Wisdom is your spell­casting ability for these spells.

The Grugach shun contact with other folk, they harbor little ambition beyond a peaceful coexistence with nature. They feel no special duty to anyone beyond their ownfolk and the forest that is their home.
You are part of an elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can select a Primal Cantrip, or replace it with another.
You can select a Cantrip from the Primal Spell List.
Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can replace that Cantrip with a different Cantrip from the Primal Spell List.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Druidcraft cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the guidance cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Mending cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the poison spray cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the produce flame cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the resistance cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the Shillelagh cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the spare the dying cantrip.
You replace the previously known cantrip with the thorn whip cantrip.
Rare creatures were more common when the worlds of the multiverse were young, but frequent conflicts with dragons much reduced the winged elves’ number.
Large bird-like wings that can be white, black, brown, or speckled.
You sprout massive wings out of your upper back.
You have a innately pleasing voice, you have advantage on Charisma checks whenever you are speaking and performing.
When you hit a creature with an Attack Roll and deal damage, you can also deal [1] to that target.
You can use this benefit a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
You are part of an Elven lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. You can sprout wings, when you do so you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
You can’t use this flying speed if you’re wearing heavy armor.
You have sprouted your wings, you can break your fall when landing, taking no fall damage. In addition, when you move you can glide rather than walk and float just out of reach of harm.
You have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
Wind and water welcome the half-elves who carry the Mark of Storm, and some learn to call on the power of the storm itself.
The Mark of Detection is an inquisitive’s dream. It sharpens powers of observation and intuition, allowing the bearer to draw connections and interpret clues others might miss.
When you make a Acrobatics check, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check.
You have resistance to lightning damage.
You know the Gust cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Gust of Wind spell once with this trait, and you regain the ability to cast
If you have the Spellcasting or the Pact Magic class feature, the you inherit spells to add to your spell list of your spellcasting class.
At 1st level, Feather Fall and Fog Cloud; 3rd level Gust of Wind and Levitate; 3rd level Sleet storm.
You can add a D4 roll and add the number to the total rolled for Investigation or Insight checks.

You are able to cast Detect Magic with this trait, 3rd level you can also cast the See Invisibility spell with it. Once you use cast a Trait spell, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.
You can use traits a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per long rest.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.
Whenever you are in dim light or darkness, both magical and nonmagical you can see twice as far. In addition you can distinguish between colors instead of seeing shades of gray.
Furthermore, your eyes are far more sensitive to light than normal. You fail any ability checks that requires sight whenever you're in direct sunlight.
Whenever you are in dim light or darkness
When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.

Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.
You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

You are part of an gnomish lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. You know the Minor Illusion Cantrip. In addition, you can also cast the Speak With Animals spell a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus without requiring a material component.

You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.
You can cast it with this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You are part of an gnomish lineage that grants you supernatural abilities. You know Mending and Prestidigitation cantrips.
In addition, you can spend 10 minutes casting Prestidigitation to create Tiny Clockwork devices.

You have proficiency with artisan’s tools (tinker’s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

You can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the disguise self spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the nondetection spell with it, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells.
When you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check, you can make the check with advantage.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you make a Stealth check, you can make the check with advantage.
Whether descended from a celestial being or infused with heavenly power, Aasimar are mortals who carry a spark of the Upper Planes within their souls.
An aasimar who was touched by dark powers, whose inner light has been replaced by shadow.
From a young age, a aasimar receives advice and directives that urge to strike at evil wherever it arises, and to stand vigilant against the darkness.
Aasimar imbued with a divine energy that blazes intensely within them. It feeds a powerful desire to destroy evil a desire that is, at its best, unflinching and, at its worst, all-consuming.
You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.
As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus.
As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled.
Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
Choose one of the revelation options below, you will inherit your Celestial Transformation, beginning at 3rd level.
You can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of that revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action.
Once you transform using your revelation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Two luminous, incorporeal wings have sprout from your back. These feathered celestial wings are capable of flight.
You unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.
You can use your bonus action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.
Once you transform using your revelation, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Once on each of your turns, you can deal extra Radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra Radiant damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.

Two luminous, spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of your revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
Two luminous, spectral wings have sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
You can use your bonus action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.
Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration,

Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of your revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell.
Your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back.
Decayed and ghostly wings that have sprout from your back. Wings of the forsaken unable to ever take flight and reach the Upper Planes.
Once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your Proficiency Bonus.

The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you that aren't an ally must each succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and ghostly, flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.

You can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself, gaining the benefits of your revelation. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
Tiefling's are linked by blood to a devil, a demon, a yugoloth, or some other Fiend.
Baalzebul, who excels at corrupting those whose minor sins can be transformed into acts of damnation. Tieflings linked to this archdevil can corrupt others both physically and psychically.
Dis occupies most of Hell’s second layer. It is a place where secrets are uncovered and shared with the highest bidder, making tieflings tied to Dispater excellent spies and infiltrators.
A master manipulator, Fierna grants tieflings tied to her forceful personalities.
Glasya, Hell’s criminal mastermind, grants her tieflings magic that is useful for committing heists.
Frozen Stygia is ruled by Levistus, an archdevil known for offering bargains to those who face an inescapable doom.
In the frozen realm of Cania, Mephistopheles offers arcane power to those who entreat with him. Tieflings linked to him master some arcane magic.
You know the Thaumaturgy cantrip. When you cast it with this trait, the Spell uses the same spellcasting ability you use for your Fiendish Legacy trait.
The hearless entropy of the Abyss, the howling chaos of Pandemonium, and the vast despair of Carceri call to tieflings who have the Abyssal fiendish legacy.
You have resistance to Poison Damage, and know the Poison Spray Cantrip.
Tieflings who have the Chthonic fiendish legacy not only feel the tug of Carceri but also the greed of Gehenna and the underworld gloom of hades.
You have resistance to Necrotic damage. You also know the Chill Touch Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast False Life, at 5th you can cast Ray of Enfeeblement.
The Infernal fiendish legacy binds tieflings by blood not only to Gehenna but also the raging battlefields of Acheron and the diabolical Nine Hells. You have resistance to Fire Damage.
You also know the Fire Bolt cantrip.
Tieflings who have the Maladomini fiendish legacy can corrupt others both physically and psychically. You have resistance to Psychic damage.
You also know the Mind Sliver Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Ray of Sickness, at 5th you can cast Crown of Madness.
Tieflings who have the Dis fiendish legacy are tied to Dispater and make excellent spies and infiltrators. You have resistance to Poison damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Disguise Self, at 5th you can cast Detect Thoughts.
Tieflings who have the Phlegethos fiendish legacy inherit Fierna's boon, tied to her forceful personalities. You have resistance to Psychic damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Charm Person, at 5th you can cast Suggestion.
Tieflings who have the Malbolge fiendish legacy are granted by Glasya magic that is useful for comitting heists. You have resistance to Poison damage.
You also know the Friends Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Disguise Self, at 5th you can cast Invisibility.
Tieflings who have the Stygia fiendish legacy are those who are tied to Levistus. You have resistance to Cold damage.
You also know the Ray of Frost Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Armor of Agathys, at 5th you can cast Darkness.
Tieflings who have the Cania fiendish legacy are those who are tied to Levistus. You have resistance to Fire damage.
You also know the Mage Hand Cantrip. Reaching 3rd level you can cast Burning Hands, at 5th you can cast Flame Blade.
Groups of elves ventured from the Feywild to the Astral Plane to be closer to their gods. Life in the Silver Void has imbued their souls with a spark of divine light.
You know one of the following cantrips of your choice: dancing lights, light, or sacred flame. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.
You know the Dancing Lights cantrip.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (based on what you chose when selecting this race).
You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you gain proficiency in one skill of your choice and with one weapon or tool of your choice, these proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.

You can mystically access a reservoir of experiences of entities connected to the Astral Plane. Whenever you finish a long rest, as you momentarily project your consciousness into the Astral Plane. These proficiencies last until the end of your next long rest.
As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to [1] to an unoccupied space you can see.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

A physical and magical transformation that alters you in fundamental ways. You can still appear as you once were, but you’ve changed in significant ways that overwrite your once physical or magical capabilities.

If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it. If you don’t keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Poised between the worlds of the living and the dead, dhampirs retain their grip on life yet are endlessly tested by vicious hungers. Their ties to the undead grant dhampirs a taste of a vampire’s deathless prowess in the form of increased speed, darkvision, and a life-draining bite. With unique insights into the nature of the undead, many dhampirs turn to the lives of adventurers and monster hunters.
You are immune to Suffocating, Suffocated, Poisoned Cloud and Stinking Cloud.
You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
You are capable of climbing up walls rapidly, equal to your total movement.

Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, which counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. You add your Constitution modifier, instead of your Strength modifier, to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite. While you are missing half or more of your hit points, you have advantage on attack rolls you make with this bite.

When you attack with this bite and hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice; You regain hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt by the bite, or You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the piercing damage dealt by the bite.
Your fanged bite is a natural weapon, with which you are proficient. You add your [1] to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with this bite.

When you attack with this bite and hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or an Undead, you can empower yourself in one of the following ways of your choice; You regain hit points equal to the piercing damage dealt by the bite, or You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the piercing damage dealt by the bite.
You can empower yourself with this bite a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You gain a bonus to the next ability check equal to [1].
You gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make; the bonus equals the piercing damage dealt by the bite.
You deal [1] with your fanged bite, restoring some health after damage is dealt by your natural weapon regaining [2].
You can empower yourself with this bite a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, all expended uses are restored upon completing a long rest.
You deal [1] with your fanged bite, you gain a bonus to the next ability check or attack roll you make, bonus is equal to [2].

Death isn’t always the end. The reborn exemplify this, being individuals who have died yet, somehow, still live. Whatever their origins, reborn know a new life and seek experiences and answers all their own.
You have escaped death, a fact represented by the following benefits. You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.

You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 and add the number to the d20 check.

You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Where wishing fails, ancient magic can offer a heart’s desire—at least, for a time. Hexbloods are individuals infused with eldritch magic, fey energy, or mysterious witchcraft.
As a bonus action, you can harmlessly remove a eye.
This token is imbued with magic until you finish a long rest.

You can cast the disguise self and hex spells with this trait. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You can see and hear from the token as if you were located where it is. While you are using your senses at the token's location you are blinded and defeaned in regard to your own surroundings.
Once you create a token using this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest, at which point your missing part regrows.
Blessed with resistance to magical and poisonous effects by the rituals that created them, each of these yuan-ti manifests their serpentine heritage in a variety of ways.

You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. In addition, you can cast those spells using any spell slots you have. You also get to decide whether to use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma as your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage.

You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait.
The serpent creatures known as yuan-ti are all that remains of an ancient, decadent human empire.
You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells.

Born of dragons, as their name proclaims, the dragonborn walk proudly through a world that greets them with fearful incomprehension. Shaped by draconic gods or the dragons themselves, dragonborn originally hatched from dragon eggs as a unique race, combining the best attributes of dragons and humanoids.

Dragonborn with chromatic ancestry claim the raw elemental power of chromatic dragons. The vibrant colors of black, blue, green, red, and white dragons gleam in those dragonborn’s scaled skin and in the deadly energy of their breath weapons.
Draconbloods possess long tails and a knack for social manipulation. They remember the days when they were once mighty conquerors.

You can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, on failed save creatures take [1] and on successful save creatures take [2].
You can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a [1] line that is [2] wide. On failed save creatures take [3] and on successful save creatures take [4].
You can use this Breath Weapon a number of times equal to [1] and regain all uses when you Finish a Long Rest.

You learn to channel the magical energy of your Draconic Ancestry to give yourself temporary flight. You sprout spectral wings on your back that last for 10 minutes, or until you are Incapacitated or retract the wings as a Bonus Action.
You can replace one of your attacks with magical energy in a 15-foot cone or in a [1] line that is [2] wide.
Spectral wings associated with the element of your Draconic Ancestry.

Gem dragonborn partake of the heritage of gem dragons, who claim to be heirs of Sardior, the Ruby Dragon. The colors and mysterious powers of gem dragons—amethyst, crystal, emerald, sapphire, and topaz—gleam in these dragonborn’s scaled skin and course through their veins.
You have a Amethyst Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Crystal Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Emerald Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Sapphire Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You have a Topaz Dragon ancestor, granting you a special magical affinity.
You can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

Dragonborn with metallic ancestry lay claim to the tenacity of metallic dragons—brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver—whose hues glint in their scales. Theirs is the fire of hearth and forge, the cold of high mountain air, the spark of inspiration, and the scouring touch of acid that purifies.
Ravenites have no tails and a hearty physique. They remember the days when they were slaves to the draconblood, as well as the day when they overthrew their masters.
When you take damage from a creature in range of a weapon you are wielding, you can use your reaction to make an attack with the weapon against that creature.
After you take damage from a creature, you can make an attack with your weapon against that creature.
Eladrin are elves of the Feywild, a realm of perilous beauty and boundless magic.

As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Immediately after up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within [1] of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
You can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Some Eladrin remain associated with a particular season for their entire lives, whereas other Eladrin transform, adopting characteristics of a new season. An eladrin’s season can change, though some remain in one season forever. Choose your season whenever you finish this trance, you can change your season.
When finishing a long rest, any Eladrin can change their season.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of Autumn. You inherit autumns boon becoming a Autumn Eladrin.
You embrace the season of peace and goodwill, when summer’s harvest is shared with all.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of Winter. You inherit winters boon becoming a Winter Eladrin.
You embrace the season of contemplation and dolor, when the vibrant energy of the world slumbers.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of spring. You inherit Springs boon becoming a Spring Eladrin.
You embrace the season of cheerfulness and celebration, marked by merriment as winter’s sorrow passes.
You change your Eladrin season taking the form of the season of summer. You inherit Summers boon becoming a Summer Eladrin.
You embrace the season of boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy.
Genasi carry the power of the elemental planes of air, earth, fire, and water in their blood.
Embodying many of the airy traits of their otherworldly ancestors, air genasi can draw upon their connection to the winds.
You have resistance to lightning damage.
You can hold your breath indefinitely while you’re not incapacitated.

You know the shocking grasp cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the feather fall spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Blur spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast feather fall or levitate with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Embodying many of the airy traits of their otherwordly ancestors, air genasi can draw upon their connection to the winds.
Tracing their ancestry to dao, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Earth, earth genasi inherit dao’s steadfast strength and control over earth.
You can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement if you are using your walking speed on the ground or a floor.

You know the blade ward cantrip. You can cast it as normal, and you can also cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

You know the blade ward cantrip. Starting at 5th level, you can cast the pass without trace spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast that spell with this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Whenever you use the blade ward cantrip, you can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
Descended from efreet, the genies of the Elemental Plane of Fire, fire genasi channel the flamboyant and often destructive nature of flame.
You have resistance to fire damage.

You know the produce flame cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the burning hands spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the flame blade spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast burning hands or flame blade with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Water genasi are perfectly suited to life underwater and carry the power of the waves inside themselves.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the innate spells you inherit.
You have resistance to acid damage.

You know the acid splash cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the create or destroy water spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the moonbeam spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast create or destroy water or moonbeam with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

Originally from the Elemental Plane of Water, many tritons entered the Material Plane centuries ago in response to the growing threat of evil elementals. Over time, triton have extended their stewardship over the sea floor to the ocean’s surface.
You can breathe air and water.

You can cast Fog Cloud with this trait. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the gust of wind spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the water walk spell with it. Once you cast any of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a swimming speed. It can understand your words, though you have no special ability to understand it in return.
Adapted to the frigid ocean depths, you have resistance to cold damage.
For some changelings, a new face is only a disguise. For other changelings, a new face may reveal an aspect of their soul.

As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight and can change your size between Medium and Small. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

Beyond the rage of Gruumsh, half-orcs feel emotion powerfully. Rage doesn’t just quicken their pulse, it makes their bodies burn. An insult stings like acid, and sadness saps their strength. But they laugh loudly and heartily, and simple pleasures fill their hearts with joy. They tend to be short-tempered and sometimes sullen, more inclined to action than contemplation and to fighting than arguing. And when their hearts swell with love, they leap to perform acts of great kindness and compassion.
The Mark of Finding sharpens the senses, guiding the hunter to prey. Alone among the dragonmarks, the Mark of Finding is carried by two races: humans and half-orcs.

Beyond the rage of Gruumsh, half-orcs feel emotion powerfully. Rage doesn’t just quicken their pulse, it makes their bodies burn. An insult stings like acid, and sadness saps their strength. But they laugh loudly and heartily, and simple pleasures fill their hearts with joy. They tend to be short-tempered and sometimes sullen, more inclined to action than contemplation and to fighting than arguing. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.
When you make a Perception or Survival check, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the ability check.
You can cast the Hunter's Mark spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Originating on the world of Krynn, kender are diminutive Humanoids who look like humans with pointed ears and diverse appearances. Kender have a supernatural curiosity that drives them to adventure.
You have an extraordinary ability to fluster creatures.
Thanks to the mystical origin of your people, you gain proficiency with one skill.
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the frightened condition on yourself.
You can avoid or end the frightened condition on yourself, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you succeed on a saving throw in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than the source of the Taunt.
You have an extraordinary ability to fluster creatures. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.

You have an extraordinary ability to fluster creatures. You can unleash a string of provoking words at the creature within 60ft. of yourself that can hear and understand you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Verdan owe their existence to chaos, doing their best to find their way in an unfamiliar world..
The black blood that is a sign of your people’s connection to That-Which-Endures boosts your natural healing.
Any Hit Die you spend at the end of a short rest, you can reroll a 1 or 2
You can telephathically speak to any creature you see within 30 feet of you.
Your people’s lack of history makes you trustworthy and humble.
Your mind’s connection to the world around you strengthens your will.
You have advantage on all Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.
Vedalken strive for perfection above all else.
You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
You are proficient with one of the following skills of your choice. Whenever you make an ability check with the chosen skill, roll a d4, and add it to the total.
You have proficiency with Arcana skill checks.
You have proficiency with History skill checks.

You have proficiency with Medicine skill checks.

When you make an ability check with this skill you add a d4 to the check's total.
Absorbing oxygen through your skin, you can breathe underwater for up to 1 hour.
Once you’ve reached that limit, you can’t use this trait again until you finish a long rest.

A firbolg’s magic is an obscuring sort, which allowed their ancestors to pass through a forest without disturbing it. So deep is the connection between a firbolg and the wild places of the world that they can communicate with flora and fauna.
You can cast the detect magic and disguise self spells with this trait.
Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
You can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and restore expended use on a Long Rest.

You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with Beasts, Plants, and vegetation. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.
Humanoids with a beastial aspect, shifters can't fully change shape, but they can temporarily enhance their animalistic features by entering a state they call shifting.
You can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action.
You assume a more bestial appearance.When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to [1]. Furthermore, you gain [2]. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. You can shift a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

You assume a more bestial appearance.When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to [1]. Furthermore, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
You can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike.

You can move up to 10 feet. This reactive movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

You assume a more bestial appearance.When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to [1]. Furthermore, While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you’re incapacitated.

You revert to your normal appearance.
Despite their formidable build, bugbears are quiet skulkers, thanks to a fey magic that allows them to hide in spaces seemingly too small for them.
You are proficient in the Stealth skill.
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift
When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is [1] greater than normal
If you hit a creature with an attack roll, the creature takes an extra 2d6 damage if it hasn’t taken a turn yet in the current combat.

A subterranean folk, goblins can be found in every corner of the multiverse, often beside their bugbear and hobgoblin kin. Long before the god Maglubiyet conquered them, early goblins served in the court of the Queen of Air and Darkness, one of the Feywild’s archfey. Goblins thrived in her dangerous domain thanks to a special boon from her—a supernatural knack for finding the weak spots in foes larger than themselves and for getting out of trouble.

When you damage a creature with an attack or a spell and the creature’s size is larger than yours, you can cause the attack or spell to deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.
When damaging a creature that is a size larger than yours you can deal extra damage to the creature. The extra damage is equal to your [1].
You can use this trait for a total of [1]. After you long rest all uses are restored.
You can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

Hobgoblins trace their origins to the ancient courts of the Feywild, where they first appeared with their goblin and bugbear kin. Many of them were driven from the Feywild by the conquering god Maglubiyet, who marshaled them as soldiers, but the fey realm left its mark; wherever they are in the multiverse, they continue to channel an aspect of the Feywild’s rule of reciprocity, which creates a mystical bond between the giver and the receiver of a gift.
People with beastlike heads, keen senses, and an innate connection to divine magic. Long ago, the ancestors of Ardlings migrated to the Material Plane, and Ardlings can now be found on many worlds.
Minotaurs are barrel-chested humanoids with heads resembling those of bulls. Blessed with a supernaturally strong sense of direction, minotaurs make great navigators.
You have horns that you that you can use to make unarmed strikes. The strikes deal [1] instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
Immediately after you take the Dash Action on your turn and move at least [1], you can make one melee attack with your Horns.
Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack as part of the attack action on your turn, you can use your horns.
You always know which directrion is north, and have advantage on any Wisdom(Survival) check you make to navigate or track.
You can make one melee attack with your Horns as a bonus action.
You can use your bonus action to attempt to push a target with your horns.
You have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes.
Gifted by the gods with remarkable physical defenses and a mystical connection to the natural world, lizardfolk can survive with just their wits and situations that would be deadly for other folk.
Kobolds are typically timid and shy away from conflict, but they are dangerous and vicious if cornered.
Some of the smallest draconic creatures in the multiverse kobolds display their draconic ancestry in the glint of their scales and in their roars.
You let out a cry at your enemies within [1] of you. Until the start of your next turn, you and your allies have advantage on attack rolls against any of those enemies who could hear you.
A loud cry for help has distracted the creature, giving allies the advantage when attacking this creature.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, all uses are restored during a Long Rest.
You can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within [1] feet of you that can see you.
Consumed by disgust and fury in responce to the performance of groveling, cowardance, and pleeing for mercy. The creature has disadvantage against attack rolls while distracted.

Kobolds’ connection to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. You have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, Investigation, Medicine, Sleight of Hand, or Survival.

Kobolds’ connection to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, Investigation, Medicine, Sleight of Hand, or Survival.
Kobolds’ connection to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. You have advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the frightened condition on yourself.

Kobolds’ connection to dragons can manifest in unpredictable ways in an individual kobold. You know one cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that cantrip.
These resilient and proud fish-folk have endured war, slavery, and mistreatment at the hands of other aquatic creatures.
You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren’t wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier.
You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
You have proficiency in the Athletics and Perception skills.
You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned or put to sleep.
You can breathe air and water, but you need to be submerged atleast once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.
The kalashtar are a compound race created from the union of humanity and renegade spirits from the plane of dreams — spirits called quori.
You have resistance to psychic damage.
You have advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see, provided the creature is within a number of feet of you equal to 10 times your level. You don’t need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

You and the target creature help each other as a free action while mind linked. So long as you both can see each other you have advantage on dexterity saving throws, and creatures have Disadvantage when making attacks against you or the creature you have mind linked. Additionally, you and that creature have advantage on intelligence saving throws. You also have a 1d6 roll bonus to saving throws, ability checks and skill checks.

Long before humanity, and before even the elves and dwarves rose to prominence, the empire of another race ruled over Etharis. Some of its people foresaw the great calamity that would claim their kingdom and locked themselves away in stasis vaults below the Stehlenwald Mountains to sleep through the apocalypse. Awakened by the mining dwarves, the dreamers have returned to the world, evolved to use the power of dreams as if they were memories.
While asleep, a dreamer can reach out and touch the dreams of others within 1 mile. After finishing a long rest, and provided you slept during that time, you may choose one skill.
Until your next long rest, you may add a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus to any rolls you make using the selected skill.
While asleep, you do not suffer penalties to Perception rolls.
You do not suffer penalties to Perception rolls utilizing senses other than sight.
When taking a short rest, you may choose to sleep for 1 hour. If you do so, you may reduce your exhaustion and regain one hit die in addition to the other benefits of a short rest.
They exist between two planes and drift back and forth, looking blurred and hazy. Once former residents of the lost mage city of Ulmyr’s Gate that was pulled through an ethereal rift.
On your turn, as an action, you can fade from the Material Realm and disappear into the ethereal plane.
You can fade from the Material Realm and disappear into the ethereal plane.
While faded away you can't interact with the Material Plane, and effects on the Material Plane can't interact with you, including spells and creatures.
You may cast the feather fall spell. When you reach 3rd level, you may cast the Blur spell. When you reach 5th level, you may cast the Blink spell.

Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can’t cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.
You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill.
You end the Fade Away effects, returning to the material planes.

After the Gods’ End and descent of the Arch Seraphs, many lesser angels lost most of their power and were forced to live mortal lives. Hunted for the power of their blood, some downcast still choose to use what little remain of their celestial heritage to further the Arch Seraphs’ cause. Others are more concerned with their own survival.
You gain proficiency in the Religion skill and you know the thaumaturgy cantrip.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (based on what you chose when selecting this race).

Aurelians exhibit traits linking them to their former master Aurelia. You know and you can cast Cure Wounds spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level or higher.
